title: Why is SKShader.CreateRadialGradient so slow in 1.68.0?
body:
### Description

My code worked on the previous version SkiaSharp 1.60.3, I tried to test it on the new version 1.68.0 (and 1.68.0-preview28 also) and found that using the SKShader.CreateRadialGradient in paint.Shader leads to very slow work, which was not observed in the version 1.60.3. I tested the SKShader.CreateSweepGradient and SKShader.CreateLinearGradient using them does not slow down. I use CPU drawing. 

Help to understand the problem. I would like to use the new version SkiaSharp in my project.

### Code

```csharp
  using (SKPaint paint = new SKPaint())
  {
    paint.Shader = SKShader.CreateRadialGradient(
        new SKPoint(50, 50),
        100,
        new SKColor[] { SKColors.Black, SKColors.White },
        null,
        SKShaderTileMode.Clamp);

    canvas.DrawRect(info.Rect, paint);
  }
```

### Expected Behavior

Normal work as in version SkiaSharp 1.60.3

### Actual Behavior

Slow work

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:  1.68.0
- Last known good version:  1.60.3
- IDE:  Visual Studio
- Platform Target Frameworks: Windows Forms .NET Framework 4.6.1

> VS bug [#752322](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/752322)
